item.title: 摩根士丹利将亚洲高级银行家奖金最高提高 40
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，摩根士丹利今年将把其在亚洲的一些顶级投资银行家的奖金提高多达 40%，原因是收入大幅增长。【原文：Morgan Stanley is raising bonuses for some of its top investment bankers in Asia by as much as 40% this year after a jump in revenue, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国 "很可能 "停止从委内瑞拉购买石油
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，美国 "很可能 "将停止从委内瑞拉购买石油。【原文：The US is “probably” going to stop purchasing oil from Venezuela, President Donald Trump said Monday.】

item.title: 特朗普再次呼吁加征关税，美元上涨，基本金属下跌
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示可能于2月1日对墨西哥和加拿大征收关税后，基本金属下跌，即使他暂缓对中国征税，市场情绪也受到影响。【原文：Base metals fell after US President Donald Trump said he would likely enact tariffs on Mexico and Canada on Feb. 1, souring market sentiment even as he held off from imposing levies on China.】

item.title: 特朗普在监管重启中废除拜登的全面人工智能令
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统废除了拜登政府监管人工智能的全面行政命令，标志着联邦对这项快速发展的技术的监管发生了重大转变。【原文：President Donald Trump rescinded the Biden administration’s sweeping executive order regulating artificial intelligence, marking a significant shift in federal oversight for the rapidly advancing technology.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税转变是对美国企业的警告，要警惕鞭打
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在第二个任期伊始，就其关税政策让世界金融市场经历了长达一天的过山车之旅，这预示着投资者和高管们未来将面临动荡。【原文：President Donald Trump began his second term by taking world financial markets on a daylong rollercoaster ride over his tariff policies, in a sign of turbulence ahead for investors and executives.】

item.title: 特朗普停止对 TikTok 的禁令，给应用程序更多时间寻找买家
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普暂时停止了美国对 TikTok 的禁令，给予该公司及其中国母公司字节跳动有限公司更多的时间就这款流行应用达成协议，以解决长期存在的美国国家安全问题。【原文：President Donald Trump temporarily halted a ban on TikTok in the US, granting the company and its Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd. more time to reach a deal for the popular app that would resolve long-standing US national security concerns.】

item.title: 特朗普希望对加拿大和墨西哥征收更多关税，美元跳涨
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统表示可能在下个月对墨西哥和加拿大征收 25% 的关税后，美元兑大多数主要货币走高。【原文：The dollar advanced against most major currencies after President Donald Trump said he may enact 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada next month.】

item.title: 碧桂园债务重组取得进展后将恢复交易
item.description: 碧桂园控股有限公司表示将于周二上午 9 点在香港恢复交易，此前这家中国房地产巨头承诺与债权人就债务重组计划达成协议。【原文：Country Garden Holdings Co. said it will resume trading at 9 a.m. in Hong Kong Tuesday, after the Chinese property giant pledged to clinch a deal with creditors on a debt restructuring plan.】

item.title: 特朗普下令美国水域开放石油钻探，推翻拜登的命令
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在上任后的头几个小时就采取了大刀阔斧的行动，释放美国能源发展的活力，废除了实际上阻止了美国大部分沿海水域钻探活动的近海石油和天然气租赁禁令。【原文：US President Donald Trump revoked offshore oil and gas leasing bans that effectively blocked drilling in most US coastal waters as he made sweeping moves his first hours in office to unleash American energy development.】

item.title: 韩国寻求更严格的退市规则以清除僵尸企业
item.description: 韩国正在收紧退市规则，将表现不佳的公司踢出局，这是韩国为提高股市质量所做的更广泛努力的一部分。【原文：South Korea is tightening its delisting rules to kick out poor performers as part of a broader attempt to improve the quality of the stock market.】

item.title: 特朗普就任总统后首个交易日国债大涨
item.description: 国债在唐纳德-特朗普就任美国总统后的首个交易日中走高，凸显了对美国没有宣布全面贸易关税的宽慰。【原文：Treasuries advanced in their first trading session since Donald Trump’s inauguration as US president, underscoring relief on the lack of sweeping announcements on trade tariffs.】

item.title: 美国贸易战威胁减弱，美元受挫，黄金保持涨势
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在上任首日暂缓对中国和其他国家征收全面贸易关税，这对美元造成了损害，因此黄金保持上涨。【原文：Gold held an advance as President Donald Trump held off from imposing sweeping trade tariffs against China and other nations on his first day in office, which hurt the US dollar.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据显示出口增长疲软
item.description: 韩国的早期贸易数据显示，本月迄今为止出口增长乏力，国内政治动荡和唐纳德-特朗普重新掌权给全球贸易前景蒙上了阴影，这给依赖贸易的韩国经济带来了越来越多的不利因素。【原文：South Korea’s early trade data showed weak export growth so far this month, as headwinds grow for the trade-reliant economy with political turmoil rumbling on at home and Donald Trump’s return to power clouding the outlook for global commerce.】

item.title: 法国私募股权公司 Ardian 募集 32 亿欧元中型企业成长基金
item.description: 法国收购公司 Ardian SAS 为其新的中型企业成长基金筹集了 32 亿欧元（33 亿美元）的资金。【原文：French buyout firm Ardian SAS has raised a €3.2 billion ($3.3 billion) for its new mid-cap growth fund.】

item.title: 台湾地震引发台积电南部工厂撤离
item.description: 嘉义市附近发生 6.4 级地震后，台湾半导体制造股份有限公司撤离了工厂。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. evacuated factories following a 6.4 magnitude earthquake near the city of Chiayi.】

item.title: 市场为特朗普的行政命令做好准备，石油保持跌势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在就职首日暂未公布针对中国的关税，但在就职后，市场对他的一系列行政命令做好了准备，因此石油保持跌势。【原文：Oil held a decline as the market braced for a flurry of executive orders from US President Donald Trump following his inauguration, after he held off unveiling China-specific tariffs on day one.】

item.title: 随着破产相关成本增加，AgroGalaxy 亏损扩大
item.description: 去年寻求债权人保护的巴西农业用品零售商 AgroGalaxy Participacoes SA 第三季度亏损扩大，原因是与破产程序有关的开支。【原文：AgroGalaxy Participacoes SA, a Brazilian agricultural supplies retailer that sought creditor protection last year, saw its third-quarter loss widen because of expenses related to the bankruptcy process.】

item.title: 特朗普任命特拉维斯-希尔为联邦存款保险公司代理主席
item.description: 根据一份声明，唐纳德-特朗普总统挑选特拉维斯-希尔（Travis Hill）担任联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.【原文：President Donald Trump picked Travis Hill to serve as the acting head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., according to a statement.】

item.title: 这不是结束"：加拿大对特朗普推迟关税持谨慎态度
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）重新执政的第一天就拒绝征收关税后，加拿大政府官员表示谨慎，称反对美国保护主义的斗争远未结束。【原文：After US President Donald Trump declined to impose tariffs on his first day back in power, officials in the Canadian government expressed caution, saying the fight against US protectionism is far from over.】

item.title: 嘀嗒难民助推部分中国消费类股票上涨
item.description: 成群结队的美国人转而使用中国制造的社交应用来替代 TikTok，这有助于提振一些内地消费类股票，因为他们代表了一个潜在的新客户群。【原文：The droves of Americans turning to Chinese-made social apps as an alternative to TikTok are helping boost some mainland consumer stocks as they represent a potentially new customer base.】

item.title: 随着俄罗斯煤炭份额的减少，中国可能从蒙古寻求更多煤炭供应
item.description: 中国去年创纪录的煤炭采购量主要是受澳大利亚和蒙古供应量大幅增加的推动，而俄罗斯的货运量实际上有所下降。【原文：China’s record coal purchases last year were driven by big increases in supplies from Australia and Mongolia, while Russian cargoes actually fell.】

item.title: 日本股市有望因关税不会立即上调而上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）上任首日没有公布具体的关税措施，这让日本股市暂时松了一口气，预计日本股市将在周二上涨。【原文：Japanese stock prices are expected rise on Tuesday on a temporary relief that US President Donald Trump steered clear of unveiling specific tariffs on his first day in the office.】

item.title: 关税威胁减弱，亚洲股市将攀升：市场综述
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统上任首日暂缓征收全面贸易关税后，亚洲市场早盘将上涨。【原文：Asian markets are set to rise in early trading after President Donald Trump held off from imposing sweeping trade tariffs in his first day in office.】

item.title: 必和必拓铁矿石产量略有增长；铜产量激增 17
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）表示，由于中国经济前景黯淡，对炼钢材料的长期需求受到压力，该公司第二季度的铁矿石产量比上年同期增长了1%。【原文：BHP Group said iron ore output in its second quarter edged up 1% from the year before, as long-term demand for the steelmaking material is pressured by a bleaker outlook for China’s economy.】

item.title: 特朗普任命马克-克里斯蒂为联邦能源监管机构主席
item.description: 特朗普政府已任命马克-克里斯蒂（Mark Christie）为联邦能源管理委员会主席，该委员会负责监督美国电网，并就数十亿美元的能源项目做出关键决策。【原文：The Trump administration has appointed Mark Christie as chair of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, the agency responsible for overseeing US power grids and making key decisions on multibillion-dollar energy projects.】

item.title: 丰业银行加入华尔街主导的银行家气候俱乐部退出行列
item.description: 新斯科舍银行是继华尔街领导的大规模撤离之后，最新一家退出该行业最大气候融资联盟的主要银行。【原文：Bank of Nova Scotia is the latest major bank to walk away from the industry’s biggest climate-finance alliance, following a mass exodus led by Wall Street.】

item.title: 纽约期金、期铜因《华尔街日报》关税报告而下跌
item.description: 由于交易商对特朗普政府不会在就职后立即征收关税的报道做出了反应，纽约和伦敦之间的铜价和金价差距有所缩小。【原文：The gap in prices for copper and gold between New York and London narrowed as traders reacted to a report that the Trump administration would not impose tariffs immediately after inauguration.】

item.title: 南非政府将公务员薪酬提高至 5.5%
item.description: 南非政府将公共部门工人的工资从 5%提高到 5.5%，以结束 9 月份开始的工资谈判。【原文：The South African government increased its pay offer to public sector workers to 5.5% from 5%, as it seeks to end wage talks that began in September.】

item.title: 尼日利亚寻求发展 12 月狂欢盛会，促进旅游业发展
item.description: 年终盛会已成为尼日利亚商业首都旅游业最赚钱的月份，尼日利亚正努力利用这一盛会来发展经济和吸引外资。【原文：Nigeria is seeking to capitalize off an end-of-year extravaganza that’s become the most profitable month for its commercial capital’s tourism sector in a bid to grow the economy and attract foreign currency.】

item.title: 经过游说，尼日利亚同意电信价格上涨 50
item.description: 尼日利亚 12 年来首次同意允许电信运营商提高资费。【原文：Nigeria agreed to allow telecommunications providers to increase tariffs for the first time in 12 years.】
